nodes.title: Draco
nodes.description: The Draco approach to constructing software from reusable components.

nodes.title: ROSE
nodes.description: Wide-spectrum support for software reusability.The ROSE tool supported 'feature-based selection' of components. Feature-orientation can be traced back to the ROSE tool and the KAPTUR system.

nodes.title: ROSE
nodes.description: Design recovery for maintenance and reuse. The ROSE tool supported 'feature-based selection' of components. Feature-orientation can be traced back to the ROSE tool and the KAPTUR system.

nodes.title: GENESIS
nodes.description: GENESIS: an extensible database management system.

nodes.title: KAPTUR
nodes.description: The KAPTUR Environment: An Operations Concept. The KAPTUR system used 'distinctive features' to distinguish systems within a domain. Feature-orientation can be traced back to the ROSE tool and the KAPTUR system.

nodes.title: FODA
nodes.description: Feature modeling was originally proposed as part of the Feature-Oriented Domain Analysis (FODA) method. Historically, FODA builds on, among others, Neighbors's work on Draco, and Batory's domain analysis of DBMS and the Genesis tool.

nodes.title: FORM
nodes.description: FORM is a feature-oriented reuse method that provides domain-specific reference architectures.

nodes.title: RSEB
nodes.description: Integrating feature modeling with the RSEB.

nodes.title: Generative Programming
nodes.longtitle: Generative Programming: Methods, Tools, and Applications
nodes.description: Generative programming is a software engineering paradigm aimed at improving productivity and quality by using automated techniques to generate software artifacts.

nodes.title: Automated Reasoning on Feature Models
nodes.description: This work focuses on the automated reasoning techniques applied to feature models.

nodes.title: AHEAD
nodes.longtitle: Feature-oriented programming (FOP) and the AHEAD tool suite
nodes.description: This work focuses on feature-oriented programming and the AHEAD tool suite.
